rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
statement_text: The human case found in Australia is of the same H5N1 strain that has spread rapidly around the world but the ones detected on the farms in Victoria are of the different H7N3 strain.

rationale: The phrase 'spread rapidly around the world' uses an intensifier ('rapidly') and scale ('around the world') with a moderate verb ('spread') to frame the virus's movement alarmingly.
statement_text: The human case found in Australia is of the same H5N1 strain that has spread rapidly around the world but the ones detected on the farms in Victoria are of the different H7N3 strain.
